00056 /*****************************************************************************\
00057  * NOTICE OF CONVENTION                                                      *
00058  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------- *
00059  * Mspec links to Pcode, Hcode, and Lcode modules.  In order to allow this   *
00060  * to take place without requiring front-end modules to link to liblcode.a,  *
00061  * Mspec code is divided into two classes as follows:                        *
00062  *  - mi_*.c must not depend on linkage to liblcode.a                        *
00063  *  - ml_*.c may depend on linkage to liblcode.a                             *
00064 \*****************************************************************************/

00077 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00078 #define M_TI_SIZE_VOID          0
00079 #define M_TI_SIZE_BIT           1
00080 #define M_TI_SIZE_CHAR          32      /* 32-bit word addressable */
00081 #define M_TI_SIZE_SHORT         32      /* 32-bit word addressable */
00082 #define M_TI_SIZE_INT           32
00083 #define M_TI_SIZE_LONG          32
00084 #define M_TI_SIZE_FLOAT         32
00085 #define M_TI_SIZE_DOUBLE        32      /* TI doesn't have double */
00086 #define M_TI_SIZE_POINTER       32
00087 #define M_TI_SIZE_UNION         -1
00088 #define M_TI_SIZE_STRUCT        -1
00089 #define M_TI_SIZE_BLOCK         -1
00090 #define M_TI_SIZE_MAX           64
00091 
00092 #define M_TI_ALIGN_VOID         -1
00093 #define M_TI_ALIGN_BIT          1
00094 #define M_TI_ALIGN_CHAR         32      /* 32-bit word address able */
00095 #define M_TI_ALIGN_SHORT        32      /* 32-bit word address able */
00096 #define M_TI_ALIGN_INT          32
00097 #define M_TI_ALIGN_LONG         32
00098 #define M_TI_ALIGN_FLOAT        32
00099 #define M_TI_ALIGN_DOUBLE       32      /* TI doesn't have double */
00100 #define M_TI_ALIGN_POINTER      32
00101 #define M_TI_ALIGN_UNION        -1      /* depends on the field */
00102 #define M_TI_ALIGN_STRUCT       -1
00103 #define M_TI_ALIGN_BLOCK        -1
00104 #define M_TI_ALIGN_MAX          64
00105 
00106 
00107 
00108 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00109 
00110 #define M_TI_MAX_FNVAR_REG              6
00111 #define M_TI_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX           64
00112 #define MIN_PARAM_SIZE                  (16 * 8)
00113 
00114 #define M_TI_NUM_FLT_PARM_REGS 2        /* 2 float parameters   */
00115 #define M_TI_NUM_INT_PARM_REGS 4        /* 4 Int parameters   */
00116 
00117 #define M_TI_INT_BASE           0       /* 6 max integer parameters      */
00118                                         /* 2 have a priority to be float */
00119                                         /* P0,P1,P2,P3,P4,P5             */
00120 
00121 
00122 /* 6 registers are used to pass parameters */
00123 /* AR2,R2,R3,RC,RS,RE */
00124 /* R2 and R3 have floating point priority */
00125 
00126 
00127 
00128 #define M_TI_FLT_BASE           4       /* 2 float parameters   */
00129                                         /* P4, P5               */
00130 
00131 /* All return values are placed in P6, which is float/int */
00132 #define M_TI_RET_F              6       /* return in R0 */
00133 #define M_TI_RET_I32            6       /* return in R0 */
00134 #define M_TI_RET_I64            6       /* return in R0 */
00135 #define M_TI_RET_ST             6       /* return in R0 */
00136

00138 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00139 /*
00140  *      The following functions are for documentation only.
00141  *      The function overhead is too great for actual usage.
00142  */
00143 void
00144 M_ti_void (M_Type type)
00145 {
00146   type->type = M_TYPE_VOID;
00147   type->unsign = 1;
00148   type->align = M_TI_ALIGN_VOID;
00149   type->size = M_TI_SIZE_VOID;
00150   type->nbits = 0;
00151 }
00152 
00153 void
00154 M_ti_bit_long (M_Type type, int n)
00155 {
00156   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_LONG;
00157   type->unsign = 1;
00158   type->align = M_TI_ALIGN_BIT;
00159   type->size = n * M_TI_SIZE_BIT;
00160   type->nbits = n * M_TI_SIZE_BIT;
00161   M_assert ((n <= 32),
00162             "M_bit_long: do not allow bit field of more than 32 bits");
00163 }
00164 
00165 void
00166 M_ti_bit_int (M_Type type, int n)
00167 {
00168   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_INT;
00169   type->unsign = 1;
00170   type->align = M_TI_ALIGN_BIT;
00171   type->size = n * M_TI_SIZE_BIT;
00172   type->nbits = n * M_TI_SIZE_BIT;
00173   M_assert ((n <= 32),
00174             "M_bit_int: do not allow bit field of more than 32 bits");
00175 }
00176 
00177 void
00178 M_ti_bit_short (M_Type type, int n)
00179 {
00180   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT;
00181   type->unsign = 1;
00182   type->align = M_TI_ALIGN_BIT;
00183   type->size = n * M_TI_SIZE_BIT;
00184   type->nbits = n * M_TI_SIZE_BIT;
00185   M_assert ((n <= 16),
00186             "M_bit_long: do not allow bit field of more than 16 bits");
00187 }
00188 
00189 void
00190 M_ti_bit_char (M_Type type, int n)
00191 {
00192   type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR;
00193   type->unsign = 1;
00194   type->align = M_TI_ALIGN_BIT;
00195   type->size = n * M_TI_SIZE_BIT;
00196   type->nbits = n * M_TI_SIZE_BIT;
00197 
00198   /*
00199      M_assert ((n<=8), "M_bit_char: "
00200                        "do not allow bit field of more than 8 bits");
00201    */
00202 }

00205 M_ti_float (M_Type type, int unsign)

00208   type->unsign = unsign;
00209   type->align = M_TI_ALIGN_FLOAT;
00210   type->size = M_TI_SIZE_FLOAT;
00211   type->nbits = M_TI_SIZE_FLOAT;
00212 }

00220   type->size = M_TI_SIZE_DOUBLE;
00221   type->nbits = M_TI_SIZE_DOUBLE;

00224 void
00225 M_ti_pointer (M_Type type)
00226 {
00227   type->type = M_TYPE_POINTER;
00228   type->unsign = 1;
00229   type->align = M_TI_ALIGN_POINTER;
00230   type->size = M_TI_SIZE_POINTER;
00231   type->nbits = M_TI_SIZE_POINTER;
00232 }

00234 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00235 int
00236 M_ti_eval_type (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00237 {
00238   switch (type->type)
00239     {
00240     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00241       M_void (ntype);
00242       return (-1);              /* can not be evaluated */
00243     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00244     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00245     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00246     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00247     case M_TYPE_INT:
00248     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00249     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00250     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00251       /* the starting address of array is used */
00252       M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00253       return (M_TYPE_INT);
00254     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00255       M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00256       return (M_TYPE_FLOAT);
00257     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00258       M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00259       return (M_TYPE_DOUBLE);
00260     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00261     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00262       *ntype = *type;
00263       return type->type;
00264     default:
00265       return (-1);
00266     }
00267 }
00268 
00269 int
00270 M_ti_eval_type2 (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00271 {
00272   switch (type->type)
00273     {
00274     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00275       M_void (ntype);
00276       return (-1);              /* can not be evaluated */
00277     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00278     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00279       M_char (ntype, type->unsign);
00280       return (M_TYPE_CHAR);
00281     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00282       M_short (ntype, type->unsign);
00283       return (M_TYPE_SHORT);
00284     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00285     case M_TYPE_INT:
00286       /* the starting address of array is used */
00287       M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00288       return (M_TYPE_INT);
00289     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00290     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00291       M_long (ntype, type->unsign);
00292       return (M_TYPE_LONG);
00293     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00294       M_pointer (ntype);
00295       return (M_TYPE_POINTER);
00296     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00297       M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00298       return (M_TYPE_FLOAT);
00299     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00300       M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00301       return (M_TYPE_DOUBLE);
00302     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00303     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00304       *ntype = *type;
00305       return type->type;
00306     default:
00307       return (-1);
00308     }
00309 }
00310 
00311 int
00312 M_ti_call_type (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00313 {
00314   switch (type->type)
00315     {
00316     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00317       M_void (ntype);
00318       return (-1);              /* can not be evaluated */
00319     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00320     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00321     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00322     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00323     case M_TYPE_INT:
00324     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00325     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00326     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00327       /* the starting address of array is used */
00328       M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00329       return (M_TYPE_INT);
00330       /* BCC - don't promote float to double now - 8/5/96 */
00331     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00332 #if 0
00333 /* commented out, because passing floats doesn't appear to work with
00334    library functions such as printf, although nowhere does it say that
00335    I have to use doubles                                                */
00336       M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00337       return (M_TYPE_FLOAT);
00338 #endif
00339       M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00340       return (M_TYPE_FLOAT);
00341     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00342       M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00343       return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00344     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00345     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00346       *ntype = *type;
00347       return (type->type);
00348     default:
00349       return (-1);
00350     }
00351 }
00352 
00353 int
00354 M_ti_call_type2 (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00355 {
00356   switch (type->type)
00357     {
00358     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00359       M_void (ntype);
00360       return (-1);              /* can not be evaluated */
00361     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00362     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00363       M_char (ntype, type->unsign);
00364       return (M_TYPE_CHAR);
00365     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00366       M_short (ntype, type->unsign);
00367       return (M_TYPE_SHORT);
00368     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00369     case M_TYPE_INT:
00370       /* the starting address of array is used */
00371       M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00372       return (M_TYPE_INT);
00373     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00374     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00375       M_long (ntype, type->unsign);
00376       return (M_TYPE_LONG);
00377     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00378       M_pointer (ntype);
00379       return (M_TYPE_POINTER);
00380       /* BCC - don't promote float to double now - 8/5/96 */
00381     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00382 #if 0
00383 /* commented out, because passing floats doesn't appear to work with
00384    library functions such as printf, although nowhere does it say that
00385    I have to use doubles                                                */
00386       M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00387       return (M_TYPE_FLOAT);
00388 #endif
00389       M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00390       return (M_TYPE_FLOAT);
00391     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00392       M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00393       return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00394     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00395     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00396       *ntype = *type;
00397       return (type->type);
00398     default:
00399       return (-1);
00400     }
00401 }

00403 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00404 void
00405 M_ti_array_layout (M_Type type, int *offset)
00406 {
00407   *offset = 0;                  /* assume first element is aligned */
00408 }
00409 
00410 int
00411 M_ti_array_align (M_Type type)
00412 {
00413   return type->align;
00414 }
00415 
00416 int
00417 M_ti_array_size (M_Type type, int dim)
00418 {
00419   int mod, size, align;
00420 
00421   size = type->size;
00422   align = type->align;
00423   mod = size % align;
00424   if (mod != 0)
00425     size += (align - mod);
00426 
00427   return (size * dim);
00428 }
00429 
00430 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00431 void
00432 M_ti_union_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, int *offset, int *bit_offset)
00433 {
00434   int i;
00435   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00436     {                           /* assume the union is aligned */
00437       offset[i] = 0;
00438       bit_offset[i] = 0;
00439     }
00440 }
00441 
00442 int
00443 M_ti_union_align (int n, _M_Type * type)
00444 {
00445   int i, max;
00446   max = 0;
00447   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00448     {
00449       int aln = type[i].align;
00450       if (aln > max)
00451         max = aln;
00452     }
00453   /*
00454    *  align to at least byte boundary.
00455    */
00456   if (max < M_TI_ALIGN_CHAR)
00457     max = M_TI_ALIGN_CHAR;
00458 
00459   return max;
00460 }
00461 
00462 int
00463 M_ti_union_size (int n, _M_Type * type)
00464 {
00465   int i, aln, max_size, max_align;
00466 
00467   max_size = 0;
00468   max_align = 0;
00469   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00470     {
00471       int size;
00472       size = type[i].size;
00473       if (size > max_size)
00474         max_size = size;
00475       aln = type[i].align;
00476       if (aln > max_align)
00477         max_align = aln;
00478     }
00479   /*
00480    *  align to at least byte boundary.
00481    */
00482   if (max_align < M_TI_ALIGN_CHAR)
00483     max_align = M_TI_ALIGN_CHAR;
00484 
00485   /* need to increment to the max. align for future array extension */
00486   i = max_size % max_align;
00487   if (i != 0)
00488     max_size += (max_align - i);
00489 
00490   return max_size;
00491 }
00492 
00493 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00494 /* NOTE: the bit_offset array is never used by Hcode, so I ignore it.       */
00495 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00496 void
00497 M_ti_struct_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, int *base, int *bit_offset)
00498 {
00499   int i, offset;
00500   int mod, size, align;
00501 
00502   offset = 0;                   /* assume initially aligned */
00503   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00504     {
00505       size = type[i].size;
00506       align = type[i].align;
00507       M_assert ((size != 0) && (align != 0),
00508                 "M_struct_layout: void is not allowed in structure");
00509       /*
00510        *  need to treat bit fields specially.
00511        *  keep them in a word when possible.
00512        */
00513       if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG ||
00514           type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT || type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00515         {
00516           int mod1 = offset % M_TI_SIZE_INT;
00517           if ((mod1 + size) > M_TI_SIZE_INT)
00518             offset += (M_TI_SIZE_INT - mod1);
00519         }
00520 
00521       mod = offset % align;     /* align to what the field */
00522       if (mod != 0)             /* needs to start from */
00523         offset += (align - mod);
00524 
00525       if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG ||
00526           type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT || type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00527         {
00528           int mod = offset % M_TI_SIZE_INT;
00529 /*
00530             base[i] = offset - mod + (M_TI_SIZE_INT - mod - size);
00531 */
00532           bit_offset[i] = offset - mod + (M_TI_SIZE_INT - mod - size);
00533           base[i] = offset;
00534         }
00535       else
00536         {
00537           base[i] = offset;
00538           bit_offset[i] = 0;
00539         }
00540 
00541       offset += size;           /* allocate space */
00542     }
00543 }
00544 
00545 int
00546 M_ti_struct_align (int n, _M_Type * type)
00547 {
00548   int i, max;
00549   max = 0;
00550   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00551     {
00552       int aln = type[i].align;
00553       if (aln > max)
00554         max = aln;
00555     }
00556   /*
00557    *  align to at least byte boundary.
00558    */
00559   if (max < M_TI_ALIGN_CHAR)
00560     max = M_TI_ALIGN_CHAR;
00561   return max;
00562 }
00563 
00564 int
00565 M_ti_struct_size (int n, _M_Type * type, int struct_align)
00566 {
00567   int i, offset;
00568   int mod, size, align, max_align;
00569   offset = 0;                   /* assume initially aligned */
00570   max_align = 0;
00571   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00572     {
00573       size = type[i].size;
00574       align = type[i].align;
00575       M_assert ((size != 0) && (align != 0),
00576                 "M_struct_layout: void is not allowed in structure");
00577       if (align > max_align)
00578         max_align = align;
00579       /*
00580        *  need to treat bit fields specially.
00581        *  keep them in a word when possible.
00582        */
00583       if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG || type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00584         {
00585           int mod1 = offset % M_TI_SIZE_INT;
00586           if ((mod1 + size) > M_TI_SIZE_INT)
00587             offset += (M_TI_SIZE_INT - mod1);
00588         }
00589 
00590       mod = offset % align;     /* align to what the field */
00591       if (mod != 0)             /* needs to start from */
00592         offset += (align - mod);
00593 
00594       offset += size;
00595     }
00596   /*
00597    * align to at least byte boundary.
00598    */
00599   if (max_align < M_TI_ALIGN_CHAR)
00600     max_align = M_TI_ALIGN_CHAR;
00601   /* enforce max. alignment */
00602   mod = offset % max_align;
00603   if (mod != 0)
00604     offset += (max_align - mod);
00605   return offset;
00606 }
00607 
00608 
00609 int
00610 M_ti_layout_fnvar (List param_list, char **base_macro, int *pcount,
00611                    int purpose)
00612 {
00613   M_Param param;
00614   M_Type type;
00615   long int *offset;
00616   int *mode;
00617   int *reg;
00618   int *paddr;
00619   int *su_sreg;
00620   int *su_ereg;
00621   int cnt, i, size;
00622 
00623   cnt = List_size (param_list);
00624 
00625   type = alloca (cnt * sizeof (_M_Type));
00626   offset = alloca (cnt * sizeof (long int));
00627   mode = alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00628   reg = alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00629   paddr= alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00630   su_sreg = alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00631   su_ereg = alloca (cnt * sizeof (int));
00632 
00633   List_start (param_list);
00634   i = 0;
00635   while ((param = (M_Param) List_next (param_list)))
00636     {
00637       type[i++] = param->mtype;
00638     }
00639 
00640   size = M_ti_fnvar_layout (cnt, type, offset, mode, reg, paddr,
00641                             base_macro, su_sreg, su_ereg, pcount,
00642                             0, purpose);
00643 
00644   List_start (param_list);
00645   i = 0;
00646   while ((param = (M_Param) List_next (param_list)))
00647     {
00648       param->offset = offset[i];
00649       param->mode = mode[i];
00650       param->reg = reg[i];
00651       param->paddr = paddr[i];
00652       param->su_sreg = su_sreg[i];
00653       param->su_ereg = su_ereg[i];
00654       i++;
00655     }
00656 
00657     return size;
00658 }
00659 
00660 
00661 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00662 int
00663 M_ti_fnvar_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, long int *offset, int *mode,
00664                    int *reg, int *paddr, char **macro,
00665                    int *su_sreg, int *su_ereg,
00666                    int *pcount, int is_st, int purpose)
00667                                         /* need to return structure */
00668 {
00669   int i, max_align, off, int_rg, flt_rg;
00670   int size, align, mod, tp;
00671   int num_flt_params;
00672 
00673   switch (purpose)
00674     {
00675     case M_GET_FNVAR:
00676       *macro = "$IP";
00677       break;
00678     case M_PUT_FNVAR:
00679       *macro = "$OP";
00680       break;
00681     case M_DONT_CARE_FNVAR:
00682     default:
00683       M_assert (0, "M_fnvar_layout: unknown purpose");
00684     }
00685 
00686   max_align = M_TI_ALIGN_MAX;
00687   int_rg = 0;                   /* Initialize number of parameters used yet */
00688   flt_rg = 0;                   /* Initialize number of parameters used yet */
00689   num_flt_params = 0;
00690   off = 0;
00691 
00692   /* Scan the function and determine the number of float parameters    */
00693   /* Floats have priority for registers P4 and P5, but if there aren't */
00694   /* that many floats, then integer parameters will take them          */
00695 
00696   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00697     {
00698       tp = type[i].type;
00699       switch (tp)
00700         {
00701         case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00702         case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00703           num_flt_params++;
00704         }
00705     }
00706 
00707   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00708     {
00709       tp = type[i].type;
00710 
00711       if (use_standard_function_call_model)
00712         {
00713           mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00714           reg[i] = -1;
00715         }
00716       else
00717         {
00718           switch (tp)
00719             {
00720             case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00721             case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00722             case M_TYPE_INT:
00723             case M_TYPE_LONG:
00724             case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00725 
00726               switch (num_flt_params)
00727                 {
00728                 case 0:
00729                   /* Occupy P0,P1,P2,P3,P4,P5 */
00730                   if (int_rg < M_TI_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
00731                     {
00732                       mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
00733                       reg[i] = (int_rg)++ + M_TI_INT_BASE;
00734                     }
00735                   else
00736                     {
00737                       mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00738                       reg[i] = -1;
00739                     }
00740                   break;
00741 
00742                 case 1:
00743                   /* Occupy P0,P1,P2,P3,P5  not P4 */
00744                   if (int_rg < M_TI_NUM_INT_PARM_REGS + 1)
00745                     {
00746                       mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
00747 
00748                       if (int_rg < M_TI_NUM_INT_PARM_REGS)
00749                         reg[i] = (int_rg)++ + M_TI_INT_BASE;
00750                       else
00751                         reg[i] = (int_rg)++ + M_TI_INT_BASE + 1;
00752                     }
00753                   else
00754                     {
00755                       mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00756                       reg[i] = -1;
00757                     }
00758                   break;
00759 
00760                 default:        /* 2 or greater float parameters */
00761                   /* Occupy P0,P1,P2,P3   */
00762                   if (int_rg < M_TI_NUM_INT_PARM_REGS)
00763                     {
00764                       mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
00765                       reg[i] = (int_rg)++ + M_TI_INT_BASE;
00766                     }
00767                   else
00768                     {
00769                       mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00770                       reg[i] = -1;
00771                     }
00772                   break;
00773                 }
00774 
00775               break;
00776 
00777             case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00778             case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00779               if (flt_rg < M_TI_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
00780                 {
00781                   mode[i] = M_THRU_REGISTER;
00782                   reg[i] = (flt_rg)++ + M_TI_FLT_BASE;
00783                 }
00784               else
00785                 {
00786                   mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00787                   reg[i] = -1;
00788                 }
00789               break;
00790 
00791             case M_TYPE_UNION:
00792             case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00793               /* Not done for TI yet */
00794               size = type[i].size;
00795               if (int_rg < M_TI_MAX_FNVAR_REG)
00796                 {
00797                   mode[i] = M_INDIRECT_THRU_REGISTER;
00798                   reg[i] = (int_rg)++ + M_TI_INT_BASE;
00799                 }
00800               else
00801                 {
00802                   if (size <= M_TI_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX)
00803                     mode[i] = M_THRU_MEMORY;
00804                   else
00805                     mode[i] = M_INDIRECT_THRU_MEMORY;
00806                   reg[i] = -1;
00807                 }
00808               break;
00809             default:
00810               M_assert (0, "M_fnvar_layout: argument is not promoted");
00811             }
00812         }
00813 
00814       /* The TI convention has the stack growing towards high memory   */
00815       /* and the parameters are referenced back from the $sp, with the */
00816       /* first parameter being closest to the stack pointer            */
00817       size = type[i].size;
00818       align = type[i].align;
00819 
00820       if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_UNION || type[i].type == M_TYPE_STRUCT)
00821         {
00822           /* make sure correct size and alignment is used for struct/union */
00823           /* passed indirectly thru registers                              */
00824           /* if IMPACT allowed structures to be passed via registers, this */
00825           /* would not have to be done                                     */
00826           if (mode[i] == M_INDIRECT_THRU_REGISTER)
00827             {
00828               size = M_TI_SIZE_INT;
00829               align = M_TI_ALIGN_INT;
00830             }
00831         }
00832       if (align >= M_TI_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX && type[i].type != M_TYPE_DOUBLE)
00833         /* anything larger than a 64-bit structure is passed */
00834         /* indirectly thru memory                            */
00835         align = M_TI_ALIGN_INT;
00836       else if (align < M_TI_ALIGN_INT)
00837         /* anything smaller that 32-bits is passed as 32-bits */
00838         align = M_TI_ALIGN_INT;
00839 
00840       mod = off % align;
00841 
00842       /* place the offset pointer to the boundary of the appropriate */
00843       /* data size                                                   */
00844       if (mod != 0)
00845         off += (align - mod);
00846 
00847       /* now increment the offset to point to the actual location    */
00848       /* for this parameter                                          */
00849       off += size;
00850 
00851       offset[i] = -off;
00852     }
00853 
00854   /* The param section must be at least certain size.
00855    * This is the backing store for the parameter regs. */
00856   if (off < MIN_PARAM_SIZE)
00857     off = MIN_PARAM_SIZE;
00858 
00859   /* now for the body of the structures... small ones first. */
00860   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00861     {
00862       tp = type[i].type;
00863 
00864       size = type[i].size;
00865 
00866       if (((tp == M_TYPE_UNION) ||
00867            (tp == M_TYPE_STRUCT)) && (size <= M_TI_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX))
00868         {
00869 
00870           align = M_TI_ALIGN_MAX;       /* must align to a double boundry */
00871 
00872           mod = off % align;
00873 
00874           if (mod != 0)
00875             off += (align - mod);
00876 
00877           off += size;
00878 
00879           paddr[i] = -off;
00880         }
00881     }
00882 
00883   /* now large ones */
00884   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00885     {
00886       tp = type[i].type;
00887 
00888       size = type[i].size;
00889 
00890       if (((tp == M_TYPE_UNION) ||
00891            (tp == M_TYPE_STRUCT)) && (size > M_TI_SMALL_STRUCT_MAX))
00892         {
00893 
00894           align = M_TI_ALIGN_MAX;       /* must align to a double boundry */
00895 
00896           mod = off % align;
00897 
00898           if (mod != 0)
00899             off += (align - mod);
00900 
00901           off += size;
00902 
00903           paddr[i] = -off;
00904         }
00905     }
00906 
00907   *pcount = flt_rg + int_rg;
00908   return off;                   /* the total size needed */
00909 }
00910 
00911 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00912 int
00913 M_ti_lvar_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, long int *offset, char **base_macro)
00914 {
00915   int i, max_align, off;
00916   int size, align, mod, tp;
00917   /*
00918    *  the LOCAL section must be max. aligned initially
00919    */
00920   max_align = M_TI_ALIGN_MAX;
00921   off = 0;
00922   for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00923     {
00924       tp = type[i].type;
00925       if (tp == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
00926         {
00927           M_assert (0, "M_lvar_layout: bit field not allowed");
00928         }
00929       if (tp == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
00930         {
00931           M_assert (0, "M_lvar_layout: bit field not allowed");
00932         }
00933       size = type[i].size;
00934       align = type[i].align;
00935       mod = off % align;
00936       if (mod != 0)
00937         off += (align - mod);
00938       off += size;
00939       offset[i] = -off;
00940     }
00941 
00942   /* the local section must be max. aligned */
00943   mod = off % max_align;
00944   if (mod != 0)
00945     off += (max_align - mod);
00946   /*
00947    *  Local variables are relative to $LV
00948    */
00949   *base_macro = "$LV";
00950   return off;                   /* the total size needed */
00951 }
00952 
00953 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00954 int
00955 M_ti_no_short_int (void)
00956 {
00957   return (M_TI_SIZE_SHORT == M_TI_SIZE_INT);
00958 }
00959 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00960 void
00961 M_ti_cb_label_name (char *fn, int cb, char *line, int len)
00962 {
00963   sprintf (line, "cb%d%s", cb, fn);
00964 }
00965 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00966 int
00967 M_ti_is_cb_label (char *label, char *fn, int *cb)
00968 {
00969   return (sscanf (label, "cb%d%s", cb, fn) == 2);
00970 }
00971 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00972 void
00973 M_ti_jumptbl_label_name (char *fn, int tbl_id, char *line, int len)
00974 {
00975   sprintf (line, "%s%s%d", fn, M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME, tbl_id);
00976 }
00977 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00978 /* Format for ti is: %sM_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME%d, where %s is the func name */
00979 int
00980 M_ti_is_jumptbl_label (char *label, char *fn, int *tbl_id)
00981 {
00982   char *ptr;
00983   int label_len, fn_len, base_len;
00984 
00985   /* Some length checks, to make sure we dont step outside array */
00986   label_len = strlen (label);
00987   fn_len = strlen (fn);
00988   base_len = strlen (M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME);
00989   if (label_len <= (fn_len + base_len))
00990     return (0);
00991 
00992   /* Check that fn is correct */
00993   ptr = label;
00994   if (strncmp (ptr, fn, fn_len))
00995     return (0);
00996 
00997   /* Check that jumptbl base name is correct */
00998   ptr += fn_len;
00999   if (strncmp (ptr, M_JUMPTBL_BASE_NAME, base_len))
01000     return (0);
01001 
01002   /* Get the id */
01003   ptr += base_len;
01004   return (sscanf (ptr, "%d", tbl_id) == 1);
01005 }
01006 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01007 int
01008 M_ti_structure_pointer (int purpose)
01009 {
01010   return M_TI_RET_ST;
01011 }
01012 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01013 int
01014 M_ti_return_register (int type, int purpose)
01015 {
01016   switch (type)
01017     {
01018     case M_TYPE_INT:
01019       return M_TI_RET_I32;
01020     case M_TYPE_LONG:
01021       return M_TI_RET_I32;
01022     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
01023       return M_TI_RET_F;
01024     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
01025       return M_TI_RET_F;
01026     default:
01027       return M_TI_RET_I32;
01028     }
01029 }
01030 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01031 /*
01032 char *M_ti_fn_label_name(label)
01033 */
01034 char *
01035 M_ti_fn_label_name (char *label, int (*is_func) (char *is_func_label))
01036 {
01037   static char fn_label[1024];
01038 
01039   if ((*is_func) (label))
01040     {
01041       sprintf (fn_label, "$fn_%s", label);
01042       return (fn_label);
01043     }
01044   else
01045     return (label);
01046 }
01047 
01048 char *
01049 M_ti_fn_name_from_label (char *label)
01050 {
01051   if (!strncmp (label, "_$fn", 4))
01052     return (label + 4);
01053   else
01054     return (label);
01055 }
01056 
01057 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01058 int
01059 M_ti_fragile_macro (int macro_value)
01060 {
01061   switch (M_model)
01062     {
01063     case M_TI_1:
01064 
01065       switch (macro_value)
01066         {
01067         case L_MAC_SP:
01068         case L_MAC_FP:
01069         case L_MAC_LV:
01070         case L_MAC_IP:
01071         case L_MAC_OP:
01072         case TI_MAC_ST:
01073         case L_MAC_LOCAL_SIZE:
01074         case L_MAC_PARAM_SIZE:
01075         case L_MAC_SWAP_SIZE:
01076           return 0;
01077         default:
01078           return 1;
01079         }
01080     default:
01081       M_assert (0, "M_ti_fragile_macro:  Illegal model specified!");
01082       return (0);
01083     }
01084 }
01085 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01086 int
01087 M_ti_subroutine_call (int opc)
01088 {
01089   switch (M_model)
01090     {
01091     case M_TI_1:
01092       return ((opc == Lop_JSR) || (opc == Lop_JSR_FS) ||
01093               (opc == Lop_DIV) || (opc == Lop_DIV_U) ||
01094               (opc == Lop_REM) || (opc == Lop_REM_U) ||
01095               (opc == Lop_DIV_F) || (opc == Lop_DIV_F2));
01096     default:
01097       M_assert (0, "M_ti_subroutine_call:  Illegal model specified!");
01098       return (0);
01099     }
01100 }
01101 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01102 /*
01103  * Declare code generator specific macro registers to the front end parser.
01104  */
01105 void
01106 M_define_macros_ti (STRING_Symbol_Table * sym_tbl)
01107 {
01108   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "r0", TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG0);
01109   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "r1", TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG1);
01110   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "r2", TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG2);
01111   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "r3", TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG3);
01112 
01113   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "a7", TI_MAC_AUXILIARY_REG7);
01114 
01115   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "ir0", TI_MAC_INDEX_REG0);
01116   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "ir1", TI_MAC_INDEX_REG1);
01117 
01118   /* repeat block registers */
01119   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "rs", TI_MAC_RS);
01120   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "re", TI_MAC_RE);
01121   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "rc", TI_MAC_RC);
01122 
01123   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "st", TI_MAC_ST);
01124   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "bk", TI_MAC_BK);
01125 
01126   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "dp", TI_MAC_DP);
01127   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$true_sp", TI_MAC_TRUE_SP);
01128 
01129   /* 1 if leaf function, 0 if non-leaf */
01130   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$leaf", TI_MAC_LEAF);
01131 
01132   /* total alloc requirements */
01133   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$alloc_size", TI_MAC_ALLOC);
01134 
01135   /* number of integer and float callee saved registers used */
01136   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$callee_i_regs", TI_MAC_CALLEE_I);
01137   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, "$callee_f_regs", TI_MAC_CALLEE_F);
01138 }
01139 
01140 char *
01141 M_get_macro_name_ti (int id)
01142 {
01143   switch (id)
01144     {
01145     case TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG0:
01146       return "r0";
01147     case TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG1:
01148       return "r1";
01149     case TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG2:
01150       return "r2";
01151     case TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG3:
01152       return "r3";
01153 
01154     case TI_MAC_AUXILIARY_REG7:
01155       return "a7";
01156 
01157     case TI_MAC_INDEX_REG0:
01158       return "ir0";
01159     case TI_MAC_INDEX_REG1:
01160       return "ir1";
01161     case TI_MAC_RS:
01162       return "rs";
01163     case TI_MAC_RE:
01164       return "re";
01165     case TI_MAC_RC:
01166       return "rc";
01167 
01168     case TI_MAC_ST:
01169       return "st";
01170     case TI_MAC_BK:
01171       return "bk";
01172 
01173     case TI_MAC_DP:
01174       return "dp";
01175     case TI_MAC_LEAF:
01176       return "$leaf";
01177     case TI_MAC_ALLOC:
01178       return "$alloc_size";
01179     case TI_MAC_CALLEE_I:
01180       return "$callee_i_regs";
01181     case TI_MAC_CALLEE_F:
01182       return "$callee_f_regs";
01183     case TI_MAC_TRUE_SP:
01184       return "$true_sp";
01185 
01186     default:
01187       return "?";
01188     }
01189 }

01193 {
01194 
01195   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_ALU_DIRECT, LTIop_ALU_DIRECT);

01200   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_ALU_INDIRECT_INDIRECT,
01201                 LTIop_ALU_INDIRECT_INDIRECT);
01202   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_ALU_REG_DIRECT, LTIop_ALU_REG_DIRECT);
01203 
01204   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_BS, LTIop_BS);
01205   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_BD, LTIop_BD);
01206   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_BR, LTIop_BR);
01207   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_BRD, LTIop_BRD);
01208   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_BU, LTIop_BU);
01209   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_BUD, LTIop_BUD);
01210   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_DB, LTIop_DB);
01211   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_DBD, LTIop_DBD);
01212   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_CALL, LTIop_CALL);
01213   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_RETS, LTIop_RETS);
01214   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_REPEAT_BLOCK, LTIop_REPEAT_BLOCK);
01215   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_REPEAT_INSTRUCTION,
01216                 LTIop_REPEAT_INSTRUCTION);
01217   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_POP, LTIop_POP);
01218   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_POPF, LTIop_POPF);
01219   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_PUSH, LTIop_PUSH);
01220   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_PUSHF, LTIop_PUSHF);
01221   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_SUBRI, LTIop_SUBRI);
01222   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_SUBRF, LTIop_SUBRF);
01223   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_CALLU, LTIop_CALLU);
01224 
01225   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_PAR_STORE, LTIop_PAR_STORE);
01226   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_PAR_LOAD, LTIop_PAR_LOAD);
01227   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_PAR_ONE_OPERAND, LTIop_PAR_ONE_OPERAND);
01228   M_add_symbol (sym_tbl, TIopcode_PAR_TWO_OPERAND, LTIop_PAR_TWO_OPERAND);
01229 }
01230 
01231 char *
01232 M_get_opcode_name_ti (int id)
01233 {
01234   switch (id)
01235     {
01236 
01237     case LTIop_ALU_DIRECT:
01238       return (TIopcode_ALU_DIRECT);
01239     case LTIop_ALU_INDIRECT:
01240       return (TIopcode_ALU_INDIRECT);
01241 
01242     case LTIop_ALU_REG_INDIRECT:
01243       return (TIopcode_ALU_REG_INDIRECT);
01244     case LTIop_ALU_INDIRECT_REG:
01245       return (TIopcode_ALU_INDIRECT_REG);
01246     case LTIop_ALU_INDIRECT_INDIRECT:
01247       return (TIopcode_ALU_INDIRECT_INDIRECT);
01248     case LTIop_ALU_REG_DIRECT:
01249       return (TIopcode_ALU_REG_DIRECT);
01250 
01251     case LTIop_BS:
01252       return (TIopcode_BS);
01253     case LTIop_BD:
01254       return (TIopcode_BD);
01255     case LTIop_BR:
01256       return (TIopcode_BR);
01257     case LTIop_BRD:
01258       return (TIopcode_BRD);
01259     case LTIop_BU:
01260       return (TIopcode_BU);
01261     case LTIop_BUD:
01262       return (TIopcode_BUD);
01263     case LTIop_DB:
01264       return (TIopcode_DB);
01265     case LTIop_DBD:
01266       return (TIopcode_DBD);
01267     case LTIop_CALL:
01268       return (TIopcode_CALL);
01269     case LTIop_RETS:
01270       return (TIopcode_RETS);
01271     case LTIop_REPEAT_BLOCK:
01272       return (TIopcode_REPEAT_BLOCK);
01273     case LTIop_REPEAT_INSTRUCTION:
01274       return (TIopcode_REPEAT_INSTRUCTION);
01275     case LTIop_POP:
01276       return (TIopcode_POP);
01277     case LTIop_POPF:
01278       return (TIopcode_POPF);
01279     case LTIop_PUSH:
01280       return (TIopcode_PUSH);
01281     case LTIop_PUSHF:
01282       return (TIopcode_PUSHF);
01283     case LTIop_SUBRI:
01284       return (TIopcode_SUBRI);
01285     case LTIop_SUBRF:
01286       return (TIopcode_SUBRF);
01287     case LTIop_CALLU:
01288       return (TIopcode_CALLU);
01289 
01290     case LTIop_PAR_STORE:
01291       return (TIopcode_PAR_STORE);
01292     case LTIop_PAR_LOAD:
01293       return (TIopcode_PAR_LOAD);
01294     case LTIop_PAR_ONE_OPERAND:
01295       return (TIopcode_PAR_ONE_OPERAND);
01296     case LTIop_PAR_TWO_OPERAND:
01297       return (TIopcode_PAR_TWO_OPERAND);
01298 
01299     default:
01300       return ("?");
01301     }
01302 }
01303 
01304 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01305 /*
01306  * Return true (1) if the instruction is supported in the hardware of the
01307  * processor.  Return false (0) otherwise.
01308  */
01309 int
01310 M_oper_supported_in_arch_ti (int opc)
01311 {
01312   switch (opc)
01313     {
01314 
01315     case Lop_NOR:
01316     case Lop_NAND:
01317     case Lop_NXOR:
01318     case Lop_OR_NOT:
01319 
01320     case Lop_MUL_ADD:
01321     case Lop_MUL_ADD_U:
01322     case Lop_MUL_SUB:
01323     case Lop_MUL_SUB_U:
01324     case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV:
01325     case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV_U:
01326     case Lop_MUL_SUB_F:
01327     case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV_F:
01328     case Lop_MUL_SUB_F2:
01329     case Lop_MUL_SUB_REV_F2:
01330       return (0);
01331 
01332     case Lop_MUL_ADD_F:
01333     case Lop_MUL_ADD_F2:
01334       return (0);
01335 
01336     default:
01337       return (1);
01338     }
01339 }
01340 /*
01341  * Returns the number of machine instructions required to implement the
01342  * specified oper in the best case.  It is assumed that this is for
01343  * supported instructions.  A call to M_oper_supported_in_arch should be
01344  * made for abnormal instructions.
01345  */
01346 int
01347 M_num_oper_required_for_ti (L_Oper * oper, char *name)
01348 {
01349 #define has_label_operand(a)    ((a->src[0]->type == L_OPERAND_LABEL)||\
01350                                  (a->src[1]->type == L_OPERAND_LABEL))
01351 
01352 #define indexed_memory_op(a)    ((a->src[0]->type == L_OPERAND_REGISTER)&&\
01353                                  (a->src[1]->type == L_OPERAND_REGISTER))
01354 
01355 #define non_zero_offset(a)      (!((a->src[1]->type==L_OPERAND_IMMED)&&\
01356                                   ((a->src[1]->ctype&0x30)==0x00)) ||\
01357                                  (a->src[1]->value.i != 0))
01358 
01359 #define short_int_inc(a,b)      (((a->src[1]->type==L_OPERAND_IMMED)&&\
01360                                   ((a->src[1]->ctype&0x30)==0x00)) &&\
01361                                  (a->src[b]->value.i >= -0x10) &&\
01362                                  (a->src[b]->value.i < 0x10))
01363 #define long_pos_int_inc(a,b)   (((a->src[1]->type==L_OPERAND_IMMED)&&\
01364                                   ((a->src[1]->ctype&0x30)==0x00)) &&\
01365                                  (a->src[b]->value.i > 0) && \
01366                                  (a->src[b]->value.i < 0x2000))
01367 #define long_neg_int_inc(a,b)   (((a->src[1]->type==L_OPERAND_IMMED)&&\
01368                                   ((a->src[1]->ctype&0x30)==0x00)) &&\
01369                                  (a->src[b]->value.i >= -0x2000) && \
01370                                  (a->src[b]->value.i < 0))
01371 #define register_inc(a,b)        (a->src[b]->type == L_OPERAND_REGISTER)
01372 
01373   switch (oper->opc)
01374     {
01375     case Lop_ST_C:
01376     case Lop_ST_C2:
01377     case Lop_ST_I:
01378       return (1);
01379 
01380     case Lop_LD_UC:
01381     case Lop_LD_C:
01382     case Lop_LD_UC2:
01383     case Lop_LD_C2:
01384     case Lop_LD_I:
01385       return (1);
01386 
01387     case Lop_ST_F:
01388     case Lop_ST_F2:
01389       return (1);
01390 
01391     case Lop_LD_F:
01392     case Lop_LD_F2:
01393       return (1);
01394 
01395     case Lop_LD_PRE_UC:
01396     case Lop_LD_PRE_C:
01397     case Lop_LD_PRE_UC2:
01398     case Lop_LD_PRE_C2:
01399     case Lop_LD_PRE_I:
01400       if (indexed_memory_op (oper) || non_zero_offset (oper))
01401         return (2);
01402       else if (short_int_inc (oper, 2) || long_neg_int_inc (oper, 2))
01403         return (1);
01404       else
01405         return (2);
01406 
01407     case Lop_ST_PRE_C:
01408     case Lop_ST_PRE_C2:
01409     case Lop_ST_PRE_I:
01410       if (indexed_memory_op (oper) || non_zero_offset (oper))
01411         return (2);
01412       else if (short_int_inc (oper, 3) || long_neg_int_inc (oper, 3))
01413         return (1);
01414       else
01415         return (2);
01416 
01417     case Lop_LD_POST_UC:
01418     case Lop_LD_POST_C:
01419     case Lop_LD_POST_UC2:
01420     case Lop_LD_POST_C2:
01421     case Lop_LD_POST_I:
01422       if (non_zero_offset (oper))
01423         return (2);
01424       else if (short_int_inc (oper, 2) ||
01425                long_pos_int_inc (oper, 2) || register_inc (oper, 2))
01426         return (1);
01427       else
01428         return (2);
01429 
01430     case Lop_ST_POST_C:
01431     case Lop_ST_POST_C2:
01432     case Lop_ST_POST_I:
01433       if (indexed_memory_op (oper) || non_zero_offset (oper))
01434         return (2);
01435       else if (short_int_inc (oper, 3) || long_pos_int_inc (oper, 3))
01436         return (1);
01437       else
01438         return (2);
01439 
01440     case Lop_LD_PRE_F:
01441     case Lop_LD_PRE_F2:
01442       if (indexed_memory_op (oper) || non_zero_offset (oper))
01443         return (2);
01444       else if (short_int_inc (oper, 2))
01445         return (1);
01446       else
01447         return (2);
01448 
01449     case Lop_ST_PRE_F:
01450     case Lop_ST_PRE_F2:
01451       if (indexed_memory_op (oper) || non_zero_offset (oper))
01452         return (2);
01453       else if (short_int_inc (oper, 3))
01454         return (1);
01455       else
01456         return (2);
01457 
01458     case Lop_LD_POST_F:
01459     case Lop_LD_POST_F2:
01460       if (non_zero_offset (oper))
01461         return (2);
01462       else if (short_int_inc (oper, 2) || register_inc (oper, 2))
01463         return (1);
01464       else
01465         return (2);
01466     case Lop_ST_POST_F:
01467     case Lop_ST_POST_F2:
01468       if (non_zero_offset (oper))
01469         return (2);
01470       else if (short_int_inc (oper, 3) || register_inc (oper, 3))
01471         return (1);
01472       else
01473         return (2);
01474 
01475     case Lop_PREF_LD:
01476       if (has_label_operand (oper))
01477         return (2);
01478       else
01479         return (1);
01480 
01481     default:
01482       return (1);
01483     }
01484 }
01485 
01486 int
01487 M_is_stack_operand_ti (L_Operand * operand)
01488 {
01489   if (L_is_macro (operand) &&
01490       (operand->value.mac == L_MAC_SP ||
01491        operand->value.mac == L_MAC_FP ||
01492        operand->value.mac == TI_MAC_TRUE_SP ||
01493        operand->value.mac == L_MAC_SAFE_MEM ||
01494        operand->value.mac == L_MAC_IP ||
01495        operand->value.mac == L_MAC_OP ||
01496        operand->value.mac == L_MAC_RS || operand->value.mac == L_MAC_LV))
01497     return (1);
01498 
01499   return (0);
01500 }
01501 
01502 int
01503 M_is_unsafe_macro_ti (L_Operand * operand)
01504 {
01505   if (!L_is_macro (operand))
01506     return (0);
01507 
01508   switch (operand->value.mac)
01509     {
01510     case TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG0:
01511     case TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG1:
01512     case L_MAC_SP:
01513     case L_MAC_FP:
01514     case L_MAC_LV:
01515     case L_MAC_IP:
01516     case L_MAC_OP:
01517     case TI_MAC_ST:
01518     case L_MAC_LOCAL_SIZE:
01519     case L_MAC_PARAM_SIZE:
01520     case L_MAC_SWAP_SIZE:
01521       return 1;
01522     default:
01523       return 0;
01524     }
01525 }
01526 
01527 int
01528 M_operand_type_ti (L_Operand * operand)
01529 {
01530   /* If NULL operand pointer, then return MDES_OPERAND_NULL */
01531   if (operand == NULL)
01532     return (MDES_OPERAND_NULL);
01533 
01534   switch (L_operand_case_type (operand))
01535     {
01536     case L_OPERAND_INT:
01537       if (FIELD_16 (operand->value.i))
01538         return (MDES_OPERAND_Lit16);
01539       else
01540         return (MDES_OPERAND_Lit24);
01541 
01542     case L_OPERAND_MACRO:
01543     case L_OPERAND_REGISTER:
01544       return (MDES_OPERAND_REG);
01545 
01546     case L_OPERAND_CB:
01547     case L_OPERAND_LABEL:
01548     case L_OPERAND_FLOAT:
01549     case L_OPERAND_DOUBLE:
01550     case L_OPERAND_STRING:
01551       return (MDES_OPERAND_Label);
01552 
01553     default:
01554       M_assert (0, "M_operand_type_ti: Unknown type");
01555       return (0);
01556     }
01557 }
01558 
01559 int
01560 M_conflicting_operands_ti (L_Operand * operand, L_Operand ** conflict_array,
01561                            int len, int prepass)
01562 {
01563   if (prepass && (!L_is_macro (operand)))
01564     {
01565       conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01566       return (1);
01567     }
01568 
01569   if (L_is_macro (operand))
01570     {
01571       switch (operand->value.mac)
01572         {
01573         case L_MAC_SP:
01574         case TI_MAC_TRUE_SP:
01575         case L_MAC_SAFE_MEM:
01576           conflict_array[0] =
01577             L_new_macro_operand (L_MAC_SP, L_CTYPE_INT, L_PTYPE_NULL);
01578           conflict_array[1] =
01579             L_new_macro_operand (TI_MAC_TRUE_SP, L_CTYPE_INT, L_PTYPE_NULL);
01580           conflict_array[2] =
01581             L_new_macro_operand (L_MAC_SAFE_MEM, L_CTYPE_INT, L_PTYPE_NULL);
01582           return (3);
01583         case TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG0:
01584           conflict_array[0] =
01585             L_new_macro_operand (TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG0, L_CTYPE_INT,
01586                                  L_PTYPE_NULL);
01587           conflict_array[1] =
01588             L_new_macro_operand (TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG0, L_CTYPE_FLOAT,
01589                                  L_PTYPE_NULL);
01590           return (2);
01591         case TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG1:
01592           conflict_array[0] =
01593             L_new_macro_operand (TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG1, L_CTYPE_INT,
01594                                  L_PTYPE_NULL);
01595           conflict_array[1] =
01596             L_new_macro_operand (TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG1, L_CTYPE_FLOAT,
01597                                  L_PTYPE_NULL);
01598           return (2);
01599         case TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG2:
01600           conflict_array[0] =
01601             L_new_macro_operand (TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG2, L_CTYPE_INT,
01602                                  L_PTYPE_NULL);
01603           conflict_array[1] =
01604             L_new_macro_operand (TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG2, L_CTYPE_FLOAT,
01605                                  L_PTYPE_NULL);
01606           return (2);
01607         case TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG3:
01608           conflict_array[0] =
01609             L_new_macro_operand (TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG3, L_CTYPE_INT,
01610                                  L_PTYPE_NULL);
01611           conflict_array[1] =
01612             L_new_macro_operand (TI_MAC_COMPUTATION_REG3, L_CTYPE_FLOAT,
01613                                  L_PTYPE_NULL);
01614           return (2);
01615 
01616         default:
01617           conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01618           return (1);
01619         }
01620     }
01621   else if (L_is_reg (operand))
01622     {
01623       conflict_array[0] = L_copy_operand (operand);
01624       return (1);
01625     }
01626   else
01627     M_assert (0, "Lti_conflicting_operands: unsupported operand type");
01628   return 1;
01629 }
01630 
01631 int
01632 M_num_registers_ti (int ctype)
01633 {
01634   /* These numbers are estimates */
01635   if (M_model == M_TI_1)
01636     {
01637       switch (ctype)
01638         {
01639         case L_CTYPE_INT:
01640           return (16);
01641         case L_CTYPE_FLOAT:
01642           return (8);
01643         case L_CTYPE_DOUBLE:
01644           return (8);
01645         default:
01646           return (0);
01647         }
01648     }
01649   else
01650     {
01651       M_assert (0, "M_num_registers_ti: unsupported model");
01652     }
01653   return (0);
01654 }
